abstract.p: Singer Smokey Robinson will perform at Count Basie Theater in Red Bank, NJ (S)

block.p: One of the sweetest, most soulful voices in the American musical canon is that of Smokey Robinson. A crooner, a rocker, he teases and taunts. Bob Dylan, considered by his fans to be the greatest living poet, called Mr. Robinson, ''the greatest living poet.''

Mr. Robinson's latest album, 1999's ''Intimate,'' was a collection of slow to midtempo love songs, but the album failed due to over-polished production and a generic R&B style. He's better than that -- ''Shop Around,'' ''Mickey's Monkey,'' ''I Second That Emotion'' and ''Tracks of My Tears'' were not flukes.

One of the sweetest, most soulful voices in the American musical canon is that of Smokey Robinson. A crooner, a rocker, he teases and taunts. Bob Dylan, considered by his fans to be the greatest living poet, called Mr. Robinson, ''the greatest living poet.''

Mr. Robinson's latest album, 1999's ''Intimate,'' was a collection of slow to midtempo love songs, but the album failed due to over-polished production and a generic R&B style. He's better than that -- ''Shop Around,'' ''Mickey's Monkey,'' ''I Second That Emotion'' and ''Tracks of My Tears'' were not flukes.
Although he left his group 28 years ago, Smokey is still a Miracle. He will appear tonight at the Count Basie Theater, Red Bank, (908) 842-9000.
